ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You develop your essay writing skills and ability to form a coherent essay and prove a point.
Improved writing skilled while focusing on modern medievalisms, how theyre used in popular culture, and what their use means through a lens of social justice.
A better understanding of how to conceptually approach studies of our past, as well as better analytical writing skills.
Writing skills

I learned a lot about writing rhetorical analysis and research papers. I also thought the theme of the course was very interesting, as I did not know that much about modern medievalisms prior to this class.
This course helped me develop skills in writing research and argumentative papers, while also giving me an expanse of knowledge on medievalisms.
I learned very valuable skills in how to understand and write academic pieces, and how to critically analyze literature.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the subject matter is very interesting but could perhaps discussions could benefit from more exploration of historical context.

The class organization was a strength! We always knew when an assignment would be due, as well as what was needed to complete it on time. The only weakness I can think of is that class discussion sometimes fell flat, but this is more due to student engagement than a fault of the course.
Good teacher; subject matter could have been more broad (eg. about the Middle Ages and not just medievalism).

Strengths: I rlly enjoyed the readings, and the writing assignments were educational; I liked the library book finding class

Weaknesses: I felt like perusal did not really help my learning, generally I annotate know my own to be prepared for class but perusal felt forced
This course was very engaging and interesting.

Professor Koepke was an amazing professor, and he made the content very interesting. The multidisciplinary aspects of the class made it truly enriching and interesting to learn, which was a very strong positive. He was also very understanding with deadlines and expectations, which made the class manageable.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their writing and is interested in medieval media from the past 50 years.
Absolutely! Writing about medievalisms is probably not something often encountered, so it was interesting to step out of my comfort zone.
Yes if you are interested in the Middle Ages.

Definitely, I enjoyed the readings and the teacher is considerate with both grading and deadlines. He just wants us to succeed, which I really appreciated. Plus, the topics were overall cool to look into, while giving us enough space to explore our own specialities.
I would recommend this course if you are interested in improving your writing skills, and if you are interested in the Middle Ages.
Yes. This course was beneficial to my learning and enjoyment.
Yes, this class was incredible for anyone. It teaches you the fundamentals you need for academic writing, and helps guide you to think more critically. Highly recommend for anyone in any discipline.
